availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Andrew McConnell (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph McConnell. Married to Sarah McConnell. Father of Cora McConnell and Isabella McConnell. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1860. Held two enslaved persons in trust in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 362B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 786.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 19.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 208A-B.
"William A McConnell (1815-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial #152981988, accessed July 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152981988.
